memberdef.definition: void boost::geometry::index::rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator >::insert
memberdef.name: insert

briefdescription.para: Insert a value to the index.

parameterdescription.para: The value which will be stored in the container.

listitem.para: If Value copy constructor or copy assignment throws.
If allocation throws or returns invalid value.

simplesect.para: This operation only guarantees that there will be no memory leaks. After an exception is thrown the R-tree may be left in an inconsistent state, elements must not be inserted or removed. Other operations are allowed however some of them may return invalid data.

memberdef.name: insert

The end of the range of values.

If allocation throws or returns invalid value.

simplesect.para: This operation only guarantees that there will be no memory leaks. After an exception is thrown the R-tree may be left in an inconsistent state, elements must not be inserted or removed. Other operations are allowed however some of them may return invalid data.

memberdef.definition: size_type boost::geometry::index::rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator >::remove
memberdef.name: remove

briefdescription.para: Remove a value from the container.

detaileddescription.para: In contrast to the std::set or std::map erase() method this method removes only one value from the container.

parameterdescription.para: The value which will be removed from the container.

simplesect.para: 1 if the value was removed, 0 otherwise.

listitem.para: If Value copy constructor or copy assignment throws.
If allocation throws or returns invalid value.

simplesect.para: This operation only guarantees that there will be no memory leaks. After an exception is thrown the R-tree may be left in an inconsistent state, elements must not be inserted or removed. Other operations are allowed however some of them may return invalid data.

memberdef.definition: size_type boost::geometry::index::rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator >::remove
memberdef.name: remove

briefdescription.para: Remove a range of values from the container.

detaileddescription.para: In contrast to the std::set or std::map erase() method it doesn't take iterators pointing to values stored in this container. It removes values equal to these passed as a range. Furthermore this method removes only one value for each one passed in the range, not all equal values.

parameterdescription.para: The beginning of the range of values.
The end of the range of values.

listitem.para: If Value copy constructor or copy assignment throws.
If allocation throws or returns invalid value.

simplesect.para: This operation only guarantees that there will be no memory leaks. After an exception is thrown the R-tree may be left in an inconsistent state, elements must not be inserted or removed. Other operations are allowed however some of them may return invalid data.

memberdef.definition: size_type boost::geometry::index::rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator >::remove
memberdef.name: remove

briefdescription.para: Remove value corresponding to an object convertible to it or a range of values from the container.

detaileddescription.para: In contrast to the std::set or std::map erase() method it removes values equal to these passed as a range. Furthermore, this method removes only one value for each one passed in the range, not all equal values.

parameterdescription.para: The object of type convertible to value_type or a range of values.

listitem.para: If Value copy constructor or copy assignment throws.
If allocation throws or returns invalid value.

simplesect.para: This operation only guarantees that there will be no memory leaks. After an exception is thrown the R-tree may be left in an inconsistent state, elements must not be inserted or removed. Other operations are allowed however some of them may return invalid data.

memberdef.definition: size_type boost::geometry::index::rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator >::query
memberdef.name: query

briefdescription.para: Finds values meeting passed predicates e.g. nearest to some Point and/or intersecting some Box.

detaileddescription.para: This query function performs spatial and k-nearest neighbor searches. It allows to pass a set of predicates. Values will be returned only if all predicates are met.

Spatial predicates may be generated by one of the functions listed below:
boost::geometry::index::contains(),
boost::geometry::index::covered_by(),
boost::geometry::index::covers(),
boost::geometry::index::disjoint(),
boost::geometry::index::intersects(),
boost::geometry::index::overlaps(),
boost::geometry::index::within(),
It is possible to negate spatial predicates:
! boost::geometry::index::contains(),
! boost::geometry::index::covered_by(),
! boost::geometry::index::covers(),
! boost::geometry::index::disjoint(),
! boost::geometry::index::intersects(),
! boost::geometry::index::overlaps(),
! boost::geometry::index::within()
Satisfies predicate

This is a special kind of predicate which allows to pass a user-defined function or function object which checks if Value should be returned by the query. It's generated by:
boost::geometry::index::satisfies().
Nearest predicate

If the nearest predicate is passed a k-nearest neighbor search will be performed. This query will result in returning k values to the output iterator. Only one nearest predicate may be passed to the query. It may be generated by:
boost::geometry::index::nearest().
Connecting predicates
Predicates may be passed together connected with operator&&().

simplesect.title: Throws
simplesect.para: If Value copy constructor or copy assignment throws. If predicates copy throws.
Only one nearest() perdicate may be passed to the query. Passing more of them results in compile-time error.

parameterdescription.para: Predicates.
The output iterator, e.g. generated by std::back_inserter().

memberdef.definition: const_query_iterator boost::geometry::index::rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator >::qbegin
memberdef.name: qbegin

briefdescription.para: Returns a query iterator pointing at the begin of the query range.

detaileddescription.para: This method returns an iterator which may be used to perform iterative queries. For the information about predicates which may be passed to this method see query().

simplesect.title: Throws
simplesect.para: If predicates copy throws. If allocation throws.
The modification of the rtree may invalidate the iterators.

parameterdescription.para: Predicates.

simplesect.para: The iterator pointing at the begin of the query range.

memberdef.name: qend

detaileddescription.para: This method returns an iterator which may be used to check if the query has ended.

simplesect.para: The modification of the rtree may invalidate the iterators.
The iterator pointing at the end of the query range.

memberdef.definition: const_iterator boost::geometry::index::rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator >::begin
memberdef.name: begin

briefdescription.para: Returns the iterator pointing at the begin of the rtree values range.

detaileddescription.para: This method returns the iterator which may be used to iterate over all values stored in the rtree.

simplesect.para: The modification of the rtree may invalidate the iterators.
The iterator pointing at the begin of the range.

memberdef.definition: const_iterator boost::geometry::index::rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator >::end
memberdef.name: end

briefdescription.para: Returns the iterator pointing at the end of the rtree values range.

detaileddescription.para: This method returns the iterator which may be compared with the iterator returned by begin() in order to check if the iteration has ended.

simplesect.para: The modification of the rtree may invalidate the iterators.
The iterator pointing at the end of the range.

memberdef.name: size

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of stored values.

memberdef.name: empty

simplesect.para: true if the container is empty.

memberdef.name: bounds

briefdescription.para: Returns the box able to contain all values stored in the container.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the box able to contain all values stored in the container. If the container is empty the result of geometry::assign_inverse() is returned.

simplesect.para: The box able to contain all values stored in the container or an invalid box if there are no values in the container.

memberdef.name: count

briefdescription.para: Count Values or Indexables stored in the container.

detaileddescription.para: For indexable_type it returns the number of values which indexables equals the parameter. For value_type it returns the number of values which equals the parameter.

parameterdescription.para: The value or indexable which will be counted.

memberdef.name: parameters

memberdef.name: indexable_get

briefdescription.para: Returns allocator used by the rtree.

memberdef.type: boost::mpl::if_c< detail::predicates_count_distance< Predicates >::value==0, detail::rtree::iterators::spatial_query_iterator< value_type, options_type, translator_type, box_type, allocators_type, Predicates >, detail::rtree::iterators::distance_query_iterator< value_type, options_type, translator_type, box_type, allocators_type, Predicates, detail::predicates_find_distance< Predicates >::value > >::type
memberdef.definition: boost::mpl::if_c< detail::predicates_count_distance<Predicates>::value == 0, detail::rtree::iterators::spatial_query_iterator<value_type, options_type, translator_type, box_type, allocators_type, Predicates>, detail::rtree::iterators::distance_query_iterator< value_type, options_type, translator_type, box_type, allocators_type, Predicates, detail::predicates_find_distance<Predicates>::value > >::type boost::geometry::index::rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator >::qbegin_
memberdef.name: qbegin_

briefdescription.para: Returns a query iterator pointing at the begin of the query range.

detaileddescription.para: This method returns an iterator which may be used to perform iterative queries. For the information about predicates which may be passed to this method see query().

The type of the returned iterator depends on the type of passed Predicates but the iterator of this type may be assigned to the variable of const_query_iterator type. If you'd like to use the type of the iterator returned by this method you may get the type e.g. by using C++11 decltype or Boost.Typeof library. This iterator may be compared with iterators returned by both versions of qend() method.

simplesect.title: Throws
simplesect.para: If predicates copy throws. If allocation throws.
The modification of the rtree may invalidate the iterators.

parameterdescription.para: Predicates.

simplesect.para: The iterator pointing at the begin of the query range.

memberdef.type: boost::mpl::if_c< detail::predicates_count_distance< Predicates >::value==0, detail::rtree::iterators::spatial_query_iterator< value_type, options_type, translator_type, box_type, allocators_type, Predicates >, detail::rtree::iterators::distance_query_iterator< value_type, options_type, translator_type, box_type, allocators_type, Predicates, detail::predicates_find_distance< Predicates >::value > >::type
memberdef.definition: boost::mpl::if_c< detail::predicates_count_distance<Predicates>::value == 0, detail::rtree::iterators::spatial_query_iterator<value_type, options_type, translator_type, box_type, allocators_type, Predicates>, detail::rtree::iterators::distance_query_iterator< value_type, options_type, translator_type, box_type, allocators_type, Predicates, detail::predicates_find_distance<Predicates>::value > >::type boost::geometry::index::rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator >::qend_
memberdef.name: qend_

briefdescription.para: Returns the query iterator pointing at the end of the query range.

detaileddescription.para: This method returns the iterator which may be used to perform iterative queries. For the information about the predicates which may be passed to this method see query().

The type of the returned iterator depends on the type of passed Predicates but the iterator of this type may be assigned to the variable of const_query_iterator type. If you'd like to use the type of the iterator returned by this method you may get the type e.g. by using C++11 decltype or Boost.Typeof library.
The type of the iterator returned by this method is the same as the one returned by qbegin() to which the same predicates were passed.

para.verbatim: // Store the result in the container using std::copy() - it requires both iterators of the same type std::copy(tree.qbegin_(bgi::intersects(box)), tree.qend_(bgi::intersects(box)), std::back_inserter(result));

simplesect.para: The modification of the rtree may invalidate the iterators.

parameterdescription.para: Predicates.

simplesect.para: The iterator pointing at the end of the query range.

memberdef.definition: detail::rtree::iterators::end_query_iterator<value_type, allocators_type> boost::geometry::index::rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator >::qend_
memberdef.name: qend_

briefdescription.para: Returns the query iterator pointing at the end of the query range.

detaileddescription.para: This method returns the iterator which may be compared with the iterator returned by qbegin() in order to check if the query has ended.

The type of the returned iterator is different than the type returned by qbegin() but the iterator of this type may be assigned to the variable of const_query_iterator type. If you'd like to use the type of the iterator returned by this method, which most certainly will be faster than the type-erased iterator, you may get the type e.g. by using C++11 decltype or Boost.Typeof library.
The type of the iterator returned by this method is dfferent than the type returned by qbegin().

simplesect.para: The modification of the rtree may invalidate the iterators.
The iterator pointing at the end of the query range.

memberdef.name: translator

briefdescription.para: Returns the translator object.

memberdef.definition: void boost::geometry::index::rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator >::apply_visitor
memberdef.name: apply_visitor

briefdescription.para: Apply a visitor to the nodes structure in order to perform some operator.

detaileddescription.para: This function is not a part of the 'official' interface. However it makes possible e.g. to pass a visitor drawing the tree structure.

parameterdescription.para: The visitor object.

briefdescription.para: Returns the depth of the R-tree.

detaileddescription.para: This function is not a part of the 'official' interface.

memberdef.definition: void boost::geometry::index::rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator >::raw_copy
memberdef.name: raw_copy

briefdescription.para: Copy the R-tree i.e. whole nodes structure, values and other attributes. It uses destination's allocators to create the new structure.

parameterdescription.para: The source R-tree.
The destination R-tree.
If true, translator and parameters will also be copied.

memberdef.definition: size_type boost::geometry::index::rtree< Value, Parameters, IndexableGetter, EqualTo, Allocator >::raw_count
memberdef.name: raw_count

briefdescription.para: Count elements corresponding to value or indexable.
The R-tree spatial index.

detaileddescription.para: This is self-balancing spatial index capable to store various types of Values and balancing algorithms.

simplesect.title: Parameters
simplesect.para: The user must pass a type defining the Parameters which will be used in rtree creation process. This type is used e.g. to specify balancing algorithm with specific parameters like min and max number of elements in node.

Predefined algorithms with compile-time parameters are:
boost::geometry::index::linear,
boost::geometry::index::quadratic,
boost::geometry::index::rstar.

Predefined algorithms with run-time parameters are:
boost::geometry::index::dynamic_linear,
boost::geometry::index::dynamic_quadratic,
boost::geometry::index::dynamic_rstar.

simplesect.title: IndexableGetter
simplesect.para: The object of IndexableGetter type translates from Value to Indexable each time r-tree requires it. This means that this operation is done for each Value access. Therefore the IndexableGetter should return the Indexable by a reference type. The Indexable should not be calculated since it could harm the performance. The default IndexableGetter can translate all types adapted to Point, Box or Segment concepts (called Indexables). Furthermore, it can handle std::pair<Indexable, T>, boost::tuple<Indexable, ...> and std::tuple<Indexable, ...> when possible. For example, for Value of type std::pair<Box, int>, the default IndexableGetter translates from std::pair<Box, int> const& to Box const&.

simplesect.title: EqualTo
simplesect.para: The object of EqualTo type compares Values and returns true if they are equal. It's similar to std::equal_to<>. The default EqualTo returns the result of boost::geometry::equals() for types adapted to some Geometry concept defined in Boost.Geometry and the result of operator== for other types. Components of Pairs and Tuples are compared left-to-right.

parameterdescription.para: The type of objects stored in the container.
Compile-time parameters.
The function object extracting Indexable from Value.
The function object comparing objects of type Value.
The allocator used to allocate/deallocate memory, construct/destroy nodes and Values.
